DataElement.preferredName: Rectum Post Radiation Therapy Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total score representing a post radiation therapy assessment of the rectum, using the Vienna Rectoscopy Score (VRS).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal._Post; occuring after._use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial
